name: 14.21 - Installation of Steel beam Guardrail and End Treatments (Proprietary Systems)

Proprietary road safety barrier systems and/or end treatment shall be manufactured, fabricated and assembled in accordance with the design and specifications provided by the system and/or device designer.
The installer of proprietary road safety systems shall provide the required quality documentation in accordance with clause 21.2 to the Administrator.
Proprietary barrier systems shall be installed as shown in and required by the design documentation and in accordance with the requirements of the installation manual.

Where the design of the system is provided by the Contractor, the design, installation drawings, specifications and evidence and conditions of acceptance for use on state-controlled roads in Queensland shall be provided to the Administrator prior to commencement of installation.
Delineation shall conform to the requirements of Clause 10.2.4 of MRTS14 and shall be installed in accordance with Part 2 of the MUTCD.

Proprietary systems shall be installed in accordance with the tolerances specified by the supplier. Where not specified, the alignment shall not deviate from the design by more than 20mm and the height shall not deviate by more than 10mm from the design.

The quality records of proprietary systems shall include:
- Evidence and conditions of acceptance for use on state-controlled roads in Queensland
- Supplier's instructions or procedures for the installation and ongoing maintenance and repair
- Details of the country of manufacture of all components
- Quality documentation showing the supplied components are in accordance with the supplier's specification
- A copy of the detailed design (where not provided by the Principal)
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Client Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
